title: How to Make Mini Cinnamon Roll Baked Doughnuts

steps.headline: Set aside 4 tablespoons (1/4 cup) of the melted butter in a bowl.
Make the cinnamon molasses.
steps.description: Combine the brown sugar, 2 tablespoons melted butter, cornstarch, 1 teaspoon milk, cinnamon, and vanilla in a saucepan.

steps.headline: Allow the mixture to heat to a bubble.
Distribute the cinnamon molasses in a mini doughnut pan.
steps.description: Add about 3/4 teaspoon into each doughnut pan cavity.

steps.headline: Add the milk and egg to the reserved melted butter.
In a medium bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients together.
Add the milk butter mixture into the bowl.
steps.description: Incorporate it slightly; never over-mix the batter.

steps.headline: Fill a doughnut pan.
steps.description: Add the batter to the cavities of the pan, about 2/3 full.

steps.headline: Allow the doughnuts to cool.
steps.description: Leave them in the pan for a few minutes.

steps.headline: Transfer the doughnuts to a wire cooling rack.
steps.description: Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Combine the frosting ingredients together.
steps.description: In a small bowl, use a wire whisk to whip everything until you achieve a smooth mixture.

steps.headline: Dip the doughnuts into the frosting.
Garnish the doughnuts.
steps.description: Before the frosting sets, sprinkle some chopped walnuts or pecans around.

text: Making the Cinnamon Molasses Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).  Set aside 4 tablespoons (1/4 cup) of the melted butter in a bowl.  Make the cinnamon molasses. Combine the brown sugar, 2 tablespoons melted butter, cornstarch, 1 teaspoon milk, cinnamon, and vanilla in a saucepan. Allow the mixture to heat to a bubble.  Distribute the cinnamon molasses in a mini doughnut pan. Add about 3/4 teaspoon into each doughnut pan cavity. Making the Doughnut Batter Add the milk and egg to the reserved melted butter.  In a medium bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients together.  Add the milk butter mixture into the bowl. Incorporate it slightly; never over-mix the batter. Baking the Doughnuts Fill a doughnut pan. Add the batter to the cavities of the pan, about 2/3 full. Bake the doughnuts for 8 minutes.  Allow the doughnuts to cool. Leave them in the pan for a few minutes. Transfer the doughnuts to a wire cooling rack. Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes. Making and Applying the Frosting Combine the frosting ingredients together. In a small bowl, use a wire whisk to whip everything until you achieve a smooth mixture. Dip the doughnuts into the frosting.  Garnish the doughnuts. Before the frosting sets, sprinkle some chopped walnuts or pecans around.
sentences: Making the Cinnamon Molasses Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
Set aside 4 tablespoons (1/4 cup) of the melted butter in a bowl.
Make the cinnamon molasses.
Combine the brown sugar, 2 tablespoons melted butter, cornstarch, 1 teaspoon milk, cinnamon, and vanilla in a saucepan.
Allow the mixture to heat to a bubble.
Distribute the cinnamon molasses in a mini doughnut pan.
Add about 3/4 teaspoon into each doughnut pan cavity.
Making the Doughnut Batter Add the milk and egg to the reserved melted butter.
In a medium bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients together.
Add the milk butter mixture into the bowl.
Incorporate it slightly; never over-mix the batter.
Baking the Doughnuts Fill a doughnut pan.
Add the batter to the cavities of the pan, about 2/3 full.
Bake the doughnuts for 8 minutes.
Allow the doughnuts to cool.
Leave them in the pan for a few minutes.
Transfer the doughnuts to a wire cooling rack.
Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes.
Making and Applying the Frosting Combine the frosting ingredients together.
In a small bowl, use a wire whisk to whip everything until you achieve a smooth mixture.
Dip the doughnuts into the frosting.
Garnish the doughnuts.
Before the frosting sets, sprinkle some chopped walnuts or pecans around.
